newsitem.title: TURKEY: Kurdish group reports Iraqi shelling in north.
newsitem.headline: Kurdish group reports Iraqi shelling in north.

text.p: Iraqi troops on Wednesday resumed shelling in Kurdish-controlled northern Iraq despite a second U.S. air strike in two days against Iraqi air defences, a representative of a Kurdish faction said.

"From this morning at nine o'clock (0500 GMT) ... the Iraqi government began to shell Chamchamal and concentrated on the main road between Chamchamal and Sulaimaniya," Shazad Saib, the Patriotic Union of Kurdistan (PUK) faction's Turkey representative told Reuters. Sulaimaniya is a PUK stronghold.
Saib said he had received his information from sources in the region. He did not know whether the shelling was continuing.

The United States launched cruise missile attacks on Iraqi targets on Tuesday and Wednesday after Baghdad's forces and a rival Kurdish faction attacked the northern city of Arbil and ousted the PUK at the weekend.
Chamchamal is about 70 km (40 miles) north of Sulaimaniya.
Saib said there were still hundreds of Iraqi tanks around Arbil -- some 120 km (75 miles) north of Sulaimaniya -- but no fighting.
